DOC.brief_summary: The study compared the acute effects of the supplementation of a standardized meal with either lupin or whey protein or no protein on the whole-body glucose and insuline metabolism.
DOC.brief_title: The Role of Whey and Lupin in Glycemic Control (Nutritional Pre-Study)
DOC.detailed_description: The nutritional pre-study had the following key objectives: Primary objective: - Lupin protein lowers the postprandial blood glucose level equivalent to or to a greater extent than whey protein. Secondary objective: - Lupin protein has an equivalent or a stronger insulinotropic effect than whey protein.
DOC.criteria: Female and male volunteers Age: between 20 and 45 years Body mass index (BMI): 2028 kg/mÂ² Fasting blood glucose within normal ranges (7099 mg/dl; 2942 mmol/mol Hb) Glycated hemoglobin HbA1c within normal ranges (46%) Agreement and signed informed consent before the study Diabetes mellitus Increased bleeding tendency (hemophilia, regular use of anticoagulants) Allergy to nuts, legume or milk protein Drug, medication or alcohol abuse (frequent consumption of more than 2030g alcohol/day) Intake of medication during the study Smoker Competitive athletes Extreme eating habits (vegan, special diets) Any other condition classed as unsuitable by the executive medical director
